comments:
When deploying the Viewer in Tomcat with JAAS enabled the viewer fails.

Tomcat 5 or 5.5
JDK 1.5

Enabled java security manager using java -D OR
System.setProperty("java.security.auth.login.config", authConfiguration);
System.setProperty("java.security.manager", "");

The Viewer fails with the following stacktrace.

Jason
label to p5 to see if we can implement this in RC0.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Does 2.1.3 have this issue too?  
> 

Yes, 2.1.3 has the same problem.
can we fix this in both 2.1.3 and 2.2.0?

Currently we find a solution to resovle this issue:
1. provide a default securiy policy for deploy.
2. fix an security bug in birt script engine.
it seems can be done in 2.1.3 and 2.2.0

but if we need support java security feature thoroughly in Birt, more enhancement need be done, we should add access controller at all points of resource accessing.
BIRT engine and viewer also need to support app server that does not have JAAS installed.  Does this fix will make BIRT engine require JAAS?

This fix will not affect applications without JAAS.
When user installs JAAS and enable java security,  user need  modify or add security policy file.
it seems the proposal can't resolve this issue, we need find another way to resolve this problem.

Are there any workarounds?  We have an older version (2.2M2) deployed within Jboss 4.0.4 alongside a WebApp that has JAAS security, but we can't upgrade the BIRT viewer to get crosstab reports until it can play nicely with a secured application.
*** Bug 192288 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
We should resolve this in RC4 as there are multiple request for this feature.
+2 to fix this for both 2.1.3 and 2.2.0.

Tried setting security policy up, no joy.

1)  Setup security as suggested.  First it choked if you just set -Djava.security.manager  and -Djava.security.policy=<a file>.  Since our app uses JAAS, it puts a security manager in place, the security manager check then returns "true" and fails when trying to instantiate "true" as a class.  So we set it to -Djava.security.manager=java.lang.SecurityManager and it got farther, but then failed on the osgi properties.
2)  In org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.osgi.OSGILauncher.setupOSGiProperties(), it goes through and clears out all of the osgi.* parameters.  I wonder why?  I forced them back in by putting them in the config.ini file, but it still had problems.  Maybe we're putting them back incorrectly?  It would help if they weren't cleared out in the first place!
Sorry, I rolled back the check-in last Friday. Please try on new build. Thanks.

Engine has solve the bug when AllPermission is provided for birt under JAAS.

This solution should also work when exact permission is assigned to BIRT. Engine will provide a list of permission which are needs by BIRT in the future.
we should provide the permission list for BIRT.
